description.narrative: Government, partners and UNICEF staff have the capacities and technical resources to strengthen the resilience of children, communities and development systems to natural hazards, climate change and civil strife, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Disaster Risk Reduction. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: India Country Programme is effectively and efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government, partners and UNICEF staff have the capacities and technical resources to strengthen the resilience of children, communities and development systems to natural hazards, climate change and civil strife

description.narrative: With year-on-year GRIP-process in 11 states, visible leadership has emerged within Government and UNICEF to proactively plan and implement risk responsive interventions to build child resilience. The work at field office level is producing far reaching results. E.g. UNICEF is directly reaching 16000 plus schools with Comprehensive School Safety Programme in nine states. Systemic engagement in school safety has influenced the state Governments of Bihar, Chhattisgarh and U.P to institutionalise chief minister school safety programmes covering over 132500 schools. In 2019, UNICEF responded to emergencies in 38 districts in 5 state. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:09/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of UNICEF supported sectors that have capacities to risk inform their programmes (flagship programmes)

actual.value: 2019:6 sectors govt. officials trained in risk informed programming UNICEF Staff and Partners trained in RIP and EPR

title.narrative: Number of States with explicit strategy and costed plan to promote behaviours, social norms, community engagement and demand for services (including accountability to affected populations), that contribute to child-centred disaster risk reduction
Number of child-responsive Road Maps for DRR, DDMPs and GPDPs, with follow up implementation and monitoring of results

Number of UNICEF State Offices with child sensitive risk and impact analysis and emergency preparedness plans integrated in sectoral RWPs addressing disasters, climate change, civil strife and other shocks and stresses for women and children
